review_title: The nicest people I ever worked for
job_title: Janitoral in Roseville, MN
pros: The management was flexible and made it a great job for a studious student.
cons: A shocking amount of the "Christian" students I worked with were amazingly lazy and entitled.

job_title: Media Assistant in Roseville, MN
pros: People are nice, and kind!
cons: Not enough pay for the amount of work we put in.

job_title: Associate Professor in Saint Paul, MN
pros: Excellent departmental experiences and student interaction.
cons: Clear discrimination in salary and compensation standards across ranks and departments. Faculty are not cared for well or compensated for the responsibilities and expectations placed on them.

job_title: On Call AV Services Technician in Saint Paul, MN
pros:
-Great learning experience!
-Good Pay!
-Flexible schedule!
cons: -picking up shifts can come and go quickly

job_title: Executive Administrative Assistant in Saint Paul, MN
pros: generous PTO, 11 paid holidays, caring employer
cons: low salaries which is the norm across higher education

job_title: Facilities Manager in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Great place to work. Culture is amazing
cons: No cons. It has been a wonderful experience.

job_title: Associate Professor in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Flexible nature and lack of fear.
cons: Lack of consideration for faculty and student safety.

job_title: IT MANAGER/PROJECT MANAGER in Minneapolis, MN
pros: High relational culture. Treats employees with respect and care in terms of work environment and benefits. My boss is awesome.
cons: Sometimes expectations on performance could be more clear. Salaries are not what you'd see in for-profit organizations for similar jobs.

job_title: CRM Business Analyst in Saint Paul, MN
pros: I have worked for UNW for the last 8 years in various IT roles and I really enjoy the community, the leadership from the top down, to the values/missions that drives everyone in their work. Work/life balance is also a big pro working at UNW.
cons: Salaries are not super competitive but the work life balance is nice.

job_title: Instructional Designer in Saint Paul, MN
pros: They have created a culture of encouragement
cons: There are very few opportunities for career growth

job_title: Library Services Assistant in Roseville, MN
pros: Solid place to work, tax free
cons: somewhat boring and not a lot to do

job_title: Usher in Saint Paul, MN
pros:
A once or twice a month job for some extra cash. 
Wonderful people.
An opportunity to be a welcome face for the university. 
Ability to see concerts and plays for free if working the whole event, (rather than only seating/taking tickets in the beginning). 
Apple cider, hot chocolate, and cookies after most events during the winter.
cons:
Only working between one and three times a month, sometimes for only two hours. 
Paid minimum wage, though that is expected for a student worker.

review_title: Most of the time a nice place to work, occasionally some very poor decisions by upper management and human resources
job_title: in Saint Paul, MN
pros: Values, Ethical, we care about each other, good 403b and health insurance, don't need to worry about bad language or womanizers/improprieties, belief in Christ strong
cons: The best employees are sometimes overloaded and then burnt out, or in the past people treated very poorly during job cuts/restructuring

job_title: Resident Assistant in Saint Paul, MN
pros: You only need to work approximately 10 hours a week and help students on random needs.  This is very manageable, as there are multiple RAs that work together.
cons: You have to be under Northwestern rules, such as no drinking and visitation hours.  However, these are not to hard to live with, given the free housing that you are given.

review_title: Warm, nurturing place to grow your skillsets
job_title: Student Technician in Roseville, MN
pros: Excellent leadership, particularly amongst the event staff team. I could tell people really enjoyed working together thanks to a healthy environment that encouraged productivity and growth. My training was thorough and comprehensive, and I felt cared for by my co-workers and bosses.
cons: Budget cuts at the university limit staff promotions and pay growth. Time-off policies for event staff conflicted on occasion with family life. Compensation doesn't always match up for overall workload when compared to other production companies.

review_title: Great place to work but could improve
job_title: in Saint Paul, MN
pros: Great people to work with but can be slightly frustrating at time due to lack of communication between people on the project.
cons: You have to know people in order to get jobs. Usually they hire from within but they are running pretty thin.

review_title: Admissions is a great place to work as a student
job_title: Student Ambassador in Roseville, MN
pros:
- Great coworkers
- Excellent superiors
- Good benefits (free meals, free clothing, free attendance at events/concerts)
- Flexible hours
cons: Some of the company's goals are in conflict. The way admissions sells the school vs. how the board and donors view the school is in contrast.

job_title: Radio On-Air Host in Saint Paul, MN
pros: I've been connected with this organization for over 25 years.  In that time, I have received excellent opportunities for growth, personal development, tuition benefits, health benefits, and a job that I love!
cons: It's in Minnesota where winter is too long, but that's nothing UNW can do anything about.

job_title: Faculty in Saint Paul, MN
pros:
Beautiful campus.
Well-meaning students.
Great geographic location for access to downtown Minneapolis and Saint Paul.
Small class sizes.
Many really dedicated, student-focused faculty and staff.
cons:
Exceedingly narrow definitions of acceptable "Christian Lifestyle"
Poor financial management of has crippled the academic programs which have meaningful connections for students' futures.
Recent rounds of layoffs have devastated academic staff/faculty morale. 
New buildings on campus seem to pop up without realistic fiscal planning.
Significant nepotistic hiring bias. 
Staff/faculty cultures maintains condescending evangelical anti-intellectual tone paired with conservative politics and dated culture warrior mentalities.

job_title: Executive Administrative Assistant in Saint Paul, MN
pros: Beautiful, amazingly well-maintained campus; Upbeat, positive people with great collaborative teamwork to advance mission together; wonderfully strong and responsive IT department; exceptional Event Services staff
cons: Higher ed in general is in the midst of weathering a storm; COVID brought new risks and challenges for keeping everyone healthy in close living, eating, classroom and working environments

review_title: Great place to work if you set appropriate work /life boundaries
job_title: Associate Director in Saint Paul, MN
pros:
Christian college that is somewhat willing to innovate
really nice colleagues
beautiful campus near a lake
cons:
Overwork because funding constraints
too much reliance on student workers

job_title: Admissions Counselor in Saint Paul, MN
pros:
Great team approach to work.
Management always asks for feedback and listens.
You feel valued as a person and know that your work matters.
Best coworkers I've ever had. Good mix of hard work and fun.
My goal is to come back as a professor.
cons: Not much room for promotion.

review_title: Freedom to turn ideas into actions.
job_title: Assistant Director of Experienital Education in Saint Paul, MN
pros:
Integrate faith in the workplace.
Work closely with great students, faculty & staff.
cons: Too much to do. Higher ed is sometimes slow to move.

review_title: Excellent work place for student work.
job_title: Facilities Maintenance in Saint Paul, MN
pros: Regular hours, supportive staff, pay pretty much as expected.
cons: Not really a con, but janitorial work can be dreary.

job_title: Stage Technician in Roseville, MN
pros: Flexible hours as a student, great work experience while in college
cons: Hour restrictions are rough being a poor college student, but what are you gonna do?

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Paul, MN
pros: Excellent team, fulfilling mission, respected organization, great location, positive culture, proud to be here.
cons: Parking can be a challenge if you don't get here early

review_title: A great learning experience of technical support systems.
job_title: IT Support Technician in Saint Paul, MN
pros: Great Managers, faculty and staff are understanding
cons: Sometimes there is very little work to be done.

job_title: IT Help Desk Technician in Saint Paul, MN
pros: Friendly staff, good management, good work experience
cons: It can polarize your resume if you're already going to northwestern.

review_title: Asst. Director of Athletic Communication and Administration
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Paul, MN
pros: Great people to work with.
cons: Not much opportunity to move up.

job_title: Communications/Marketing Assistant in Saint Paul, MN
pros: Flexibility, culture, working remotely, good collaboration meetings
cons: I haven't had an issues here.

job_title: Public Safety
pros: Easy to learn and work, relaxed environment.
cons: Overnight hours, low pay, bad department communication

job_title: Teaching Assistant in Saint Paul, MN
pros: The faculty were really supportive
cons: Less funding for research and fewer research opportunities
